Interface Lot

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractLot, PartLot, ProductLot
public interface Lot

Defines the interface for lots in an inventory system. A lot represents a group of items (parts or products) of the same type that were received or manufactured at the same time.

Version:
2007-09
Author:
J. Bigus

Method Detail

computeCost

Money computeCost()
Calculates the cost of the lot. This value is calculated by multiplying the number of items in the lot by the cost of an item.

Returns:
the cost of the lot.

getDateAdded

java.util.Date getDateAdded()
Returns the date the lot was added to inventory.

Returns:
the Date the lot was added to inventory.

getDescription

java.lang.String getDescription()
Returns the description of the items contained in the lot.

Returns:
the description of the items contained in the lot.

getItemCost

Money getItemCost()
Returns the cost of each item in the lot. All items in a single lot cost the same amount, but the same item in a different lot may have a different cost.

Returns:
the cost of each item in the lot.

getItemId

java.lang.String getItemId()
Returns the id of the items contained in the lot.

Returns:
the id of the items contained in the lot.

getNumber

int getNumber()
Returns the lot number that was assigned when the lot was added to inventory. Lot numbers are not reused.

Returns:
the lot number.

getQty

int getQty()
Returns the quantity of items in the lot. When items are removed from inventory, the quantity is decreased. When the quantity is zero, the lot is removed from inventory.

Returns:
the quanity of items in the lot.

setDateAdded

void setDateAdded(java.util.Date date)
Sets the date the lot was added to inventory.

Parameters:
date - the date the lot was added to inventory.

setDescription

void setDescription(java.lang.String desc)
Records the description of the items contained in the lot.

Parameters:
desc - the item contained in the lot.

setItemCost

void setItemCost(Money cost)
Sets the cost of each item in the lot. All items in a single lot cost the same amount, but the same item in a different lot may have a different cost. The cost varies for different lots because the item may have cost more (or less) to manufacture or to buy from a different supplier.

Parameters:
cost - the cost of each item in the lot.

setItemId

void setItemId(java.lang.String id)
Records the id of the items contained in the lot.

Parameters:
id - the id of the items contained in the lot.

setNumber

void setNumber(int lotNo)
Assigns the lot number. A lot is assigned a number when the lot is added to inventory. Lot numbers are not reused.

Parameters:
lotNo - the lot number assigned when the lot is added to inventory.

setQty

void setQty(int quantity)
Changes the quantity of items in the lot.

Parameters:
quantity - the new quantity of items in the lot.
